title: noormcs5
author: noormcs5
content: There are cloud storage devices like one drive which offer 5GB space for free. Can you tell me any cloud storage spaces which accept bitcoin payment and also if there are any free cloud storage devices which offer more data storage ?

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Google will give you better and more results according to your desire, unless you are looking for personal use details or privacy terms and others.Through a simple search, I found that this service accepts bitcoins ----> https://www.sync.com/. Do a search for it and compare its prices with other available services.In general, if the service does not require KYC, you can pay with bitcoin (even if they do not accept Bitcoin) by gift cards or Bitcoin payment cards.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on January 28, 2023, 05:37:51 AMCan you tell me any cloud storage spaces which accept bitcoin paymentYes. RamNode for instance.Quoteand also if there are any free cloud storage devices which offer more data storage ?They don't.What are you looking for? "Free" usually requires a credit cards so they can bill you for anything you go over the free limit. Without credit card verification, it would get abused.The "cloud" part usually means you want/need scalability, while a "normal" VPS is cheaper (but less flexible) if you just pay it for a year. I was recently testing a cloud provider that you can use after depositing $1 in Bitcoin, but there are more reliable (and more expensive) options out there for Bitcoin users too.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on January 28, 2023, 07:09:51 AMQuoteand also if there are any free cloud storage devices which offer more data storage ?They don't.What are you looking for? "Free" usually requires a credit cards so they can bill you for anything you go over the free limit. Without credit card verification, it would get abused.Actually I do have 2 free accounts, on two platforms, both over 10 GB. One I was lucky to find out in their early days and they were giving huge space.The other is well known, it's Dropbox. If one starts using Dropbox from a referral, he already gets more than the default 2 GB (gets 2.5 GB?). When I've made my Dropbox account, if one has made certain "learning" steps, has got more storage, I don't know if it still happens. But: by getting others make Dropbox account under your referral, you'll get 512 MB (I think) for each new person (I don't know under what limits). Yes, it can be abused if one has too much time (it needs to actually install and run Dropbox for those accounts) . But it doesn't need credit card.So I expect that one, especially if he's knowledgeable and determined, can get over 5 GB at Dropbox without paying and without giving out card info. How safe is Dropbox privacy wise? Well.. I don't have too big expectations.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on January 28, 2023, 05:37:51 AMThere are cloud storage devices like one drive which offer 5GB space for free. Can you tell me any cloud storage spaces which accept bitcoin payment and also if there are any free cloud storage devices which offer more data storage ?I’m using mediafire to upload some of my files in cloud storage. It has 15gb free storage and you earn up to 39gb free for every sign up that you can get for sharing your referral link. This platform has a decent speed for both upload and download. Also this cloud storage has been active for so long and I’m using it since my collage days to store my personal files that time. Until now I have those file save on my mediafire account.You can upgrade to 1TB for 3.75$ per month but it only support support bank or card payment. This is the best offer that I knew for a cloud storage with that capacity. https://www.mediafire.com

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: 1fichier accepts bitcoin (and bank transfer, but NOT cards or PayPal) and I have used them in the past for stuff.https://1fichier.com

comments.author: AnonBitCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on January 28, 2023, 05:37:51 AMThere are cloud storage devices like one drive which offer 5GB space for free. Can you tell me any cloud storage spaces which accept bitcoin payment and also if there are any free cloud storage devices which offer more data storage ?Sync.com is best one and it's best suitable for those who want BTC as a payment. There are lot of best cloud storage platform which offer best rate with maximum storage but they only accept Paypal or Visa card. Dropbox is one of them but hence you mentioned that you want to pay via BTC so I think Sync will be best for you.It's package plan is also not Worth and there is two options for you,Team and solo. Solo package start from 8$/month with 2 TB storage and your are free to check and cancel any time. More packages and storage plans can be found in official site.
